Errr, I'd be horrified if any polearm arrived to me cut in half, let 
alone a collectors item. I suspect if you delve a little deeper, they 
likely make replicas that just hang on the wall for a customer base that 
is prepared to sacrifice utility & authenticity for cheap to deliver & 
looks good hanging there.


On 12/09/2011 6:25 a.m., abale.vossnet.co.uk wrote:
> This sounds like a sensible way to ship polearms:
>
> The overseas delivery for very long items by Air Delivery is limited to
> 1.5 metres in length. As it can be expensive to deliver single articles
> by shipping them Sea Freight, some over-long items are not prudent to
> send abroad. Pole arms can, however, have the shaft cut in half and very
> simply re-affixed at the destination [either personally, by the buyer,
> or by a basic carpenter]. This has been the accepted method of
> transporting pole arms for many, many, years and is perfectly suitable
> and effective.
>
> This is from The Lanes Armoury in Brighton, UK, I have never heard of
> this before but then I don't ship yari.
>
> Alan
